timeline.bodyText: Should we use Collections.emptyMap() here to use a singleton instead of creating a new instance?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Thoughts on deferring instantiation of a new map until we know the FilterBlobItem has tags, if it doesn't use the singleton Collections.emptyMap().
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: This translates responses of an API where you filter blobs by tags. Unless you're purposefully using an older service version, tags should never be empty.
replies.author: jaschrep-msft

replies.bodyText: Given a refactor Gauri suggested, it may actually be good to do this, as the guarantee I presented would no longer be applicable.
replies.author: jaschrep-msft

replies.bodyText: yeah, we shouldn't create empty maps if not required.
replies.author: kasobol-msft

timeline.bodyText: Could we consolidate this logic (BlobTagSet -> Map of tags) into another method in ModelHelper? There's some duplicate logic in BlobAsyncClient.getTagsWithResponse and ModelHelper.populateBlobItem,
timeline.author: gapra-msft
kasobol-msft
